alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:08PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Collier County through 600 PM EDT... At 508 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud 7 miles east of Royal Palm Hammock, or 9 miles northwest of Everglades City, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marco Island, Chokoloskee, Everglades City, Plantation Island, Carnestown, Marco Island Airport, Copeland, Royal Palm Hammock, South Blocks Golde, Fakahatchee Strand State Preserve, Picayune Strand State Forest, Port Of The Island, Goodland, Key Marco, Cape Romano Aquatic Preserve, Jerome and Deep Lake. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Inland Collier County; Mainland Monroe
